page.title: 09Farming Patterns Eastchurch
page.content: {Farming}patterns have, and still are slowly changing. Orchards of apples and pears are gradually being removed and the land used for different purposes. Farms are mainly {arable,}the main crops being wheat, potatoes, peas and oil seed rape which are grown in rotation . These{crops are particularly suited to the clay soil of the area. The soil has to be limed regularly to compensate for this. Some farms have flocks of sheep and a few have a dairy herd but there is a tendency to change to arable farming for{economic}reasons. There is a high level of mechanisation with farmers owning their machinery and therefore there has been a reduction in manual labour.
